metadata.title: CVE-2017-6410 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
kpac/script.cpp in KDE kio before 5.32 and kdelibs before 4.14.30 calls thePAC FindProxyForURL function with a full https URL (potentially includingBasic Authentication credentials, a query string, or PATH_INFO), whichallows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information via a crafted PACfile.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-6410` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kio - 5.18.0-0ubuntu1.1
libkf5kiocore5 - 5.18.0-0ubuntu1.1
libkf5kiofilewidgets5 - 5.18.0-0ubuntu1.1
libkf5kiontlm5 - 5.18.0-0ubuntu1.1
libkf5kiowidgets5 - 5.18.0-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

kdelibs-bin - 4:4.14.16-0ubuntu3.1
kdelibs5-data - 4:4.14.16-0ubuntu3.1
kdelibs5-plugins - 4:4.14.16-0ubuntu3.1
kdoctools - 4:4.14.16-0ubuntu3.1
libkcmutils4 - 4:4.14.16-0ubuntu3.1
libkde3support4 - 4:4.14.16-0ubuntu3.1

libknewstuff3-4 - 4:4.14.16-0ubuntu3.1

criterions.comment: kio package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.18.0-0ubuntu1.1').
kde4libs package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4:4.14.16-0ubuntu3.1').
